item.description:

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet & torn. Upon inspection found 2 bottles of Paramount super concentrated machine dishwash 1-gallon had loose lids resulted to leakage. The plastic plug caps & seals beneath lids were wet & loose allowing leakage. DescribePack: Bottles had loose lids along with the plastic plug caps & seals beneath lids were wet & loose resulted to leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080088
item.description:
Report X-2023080088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. brought back by driver after noticing the pkg. was wet. Pkg. taken to QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: Upon inspection, it was noted that 1 of the 4 gallon containers had a loose cap, causing liquid to leak out. No partitions inside, just a cardboard top, no plastic bags. Orientation arrows on side of box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. placed in the HWPA awaiting instructions from PGH.

item.title: Report X-2023080070
item.description:
Report X-2023080070

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The pail arrived to the station leaking out from a dented/compromised lid. Upon discovery it was brought over to QA to be fully processed and contained. DescribePack: There is a noticeable dent that goes from the top of the pail all the way to bottom as it appears that the pail was either dropped or was collided with. The dent deformed the area around the lid, allowing the contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: There was no release found as the leakage seems to have dried up around the closure and along the pail

item.description:
Report X-2023070298

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-08
  • City: LAUDERHILL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED THROUGH RADIO OF A LEAKING PACKAGE, RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND RETRIEVED SPILL CART. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE RESPONDER DETERMINED THAT CONTAINMENT SHEET FOR 1.4 EXPLOSIVES WAS TO BE USED. AREA WHERE THE PACKAGE IS LOCATED WAS CORDONNED OFF AND CHAIN OF COMMAND WAS NOTIFIED. OUTSIDE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO CLEAN UP PACKAGE.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of degaroute (un1866) had been punctured by a sharp object and had released 1 quart of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release. so no contractors were dispatched.

item.description:
Report E-2023070933

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy driver inadvertently opened a valve on the trailer prior to connecting the delivery hose to the storage tank. This allowed approximately 30 gallons of diesel fuel to be released. AOTC Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report X-2023070283
item.description:
Report X-2023070283

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-17
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was found and offered to the dangerous goods specialist at our Ocala Fl station location during morning sort. Package was a plastic pak and employee could hear what they describe as a metal ball rattling. They believed the package could contain an aerosol can inside. Package was opened for inspection and a spray can of Alu-Mend was found inside. Label on can claimed contents to be flammable and under pressure. There were no DG marks nor labels to indicate package contained an aerosol. Package has been held at station location pending FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2023070967
item.description:
Report E-2023070967

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated he is hands off loading at Symrise. Operators were inside a building while the trailer was being loaded and the clock in that office was off. About 30 gallons was spilled. This all happened in a containment area. Nothing is needed from GTI. Symrise will pump out some product to ensure weight compliance. Trailer will be washed at tank wash after leaving Symrise.

item.title: Report X-2023080117

  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080117 SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to be leaking during the unload process. Package was immediately placed in a bag and tote and brought to the hazmat cage to be processed. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was instantly placed in a tote to mitigate the spill. 2. X-2023080485 SequenceEvent: It appears that the package was dropped by a package handler during the unload process resulting in the bottles inside of the box being cracked at the side. DescribePack: Bottles inside of package were cracked open at the sides resulting in the liquid leaking out of the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Items were placed in a hazmat bag and then placed inside of a hazmat drum while waiting to be processed.
